document_data.name: Prismatic Wall
document_data.mainbody: '''''Prismatic wall''''' was a powerful [[abjuration]] spell that created a protective wall that affected any creature trying to cross it with a variety of effects.

Effects.Red: Inflicted [[fire]] damage. It could be destroyed by cold damage.
Effects.Orange: Inflicted [[acid]] damage. It could be destroyed by a strong wind.
Effects.Yellow: Inflicted lightning damage. It could be destroyed by [[force]] damage.
Effects.Green: Inflicted [[poison]] damage. It could be destroyed by a ''[[passwall]]'' spell or any more powerful spell that could open a passage on a solid surface.
Effects.Blue: Inflicted cold damage. It could be destroyed by [[fire]] damage.
Effects.Indigo: A creature affected by this layer became paralyzed and could be subsequently turned to stone. It also prevented spells from being cast through the wall. It could be destroyed by a ''[[daylight]]'' spell or any more powerful spell that created bright light.
Effects.Violet:
A creature affected by this layer became blind, and could be subsequently banished to another [[plane]]. It could be destroyed by a ''[[dispel magic]]'' or more powerful spell that ended magical effects.

The wall was immune to the ''[[antimagic field]]'' spell, but it could be completely destroyed at once by a ''[[rod of cancellation]]''.

document_data.Components: The spell required only [[Verbal component|verbal]] and [[Somatic component|somatic]] components.
document_data.History: The spell was attributed to [[Netherese arcanist]] [[Anglin]] of [[Seventon]] in {{Yearlink|-1923}} and was originally called ''Anglin's wall''.
